meanings.definition: Having little or no money; penniless.
meanings.sent1: The impecunious man couldn't afford to buy food for his family.
meanings.sent2: She lived an impecunious life, always struggling to make ends meet.
meanings.sent3: The impecunious student tried to pay for his textbooks with a bag of marbles.
meanings.sent4: Her impecunious situation felt like being trapped in a deep, dark hole.
meanings.sent5: The image of the impecunious beggar sitting on the sidewalk haunted her dreams.

meanings.sent1: The impecunious family had to rely on food donations to survive.
meanings.sent2: Despite working multiple jobs, he remained impecunious due to mounting debts.
meanings.sent3: The impecunious clown tried to juggle invisible balls to earn money.
meanings.sent4: Her impecunious state of mind felt like being lost in a vast desert.
meanings.sent5: The impecunious artist painted with passion, using only borrowed brushes.
